intro: Justicia leucodermis, commonly known as the white-stemmed jewelweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It features slender, branching stems that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming during the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Justicia leucodermis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
